articles.title: Song Jeering at NSL in S. Korea
articles.content:
Song Jeering at NSL in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- A south Korean popular musician Yun Min Sok recently created a song ridiculing the "National Security Law" (NSL), according to MBC of south Korea.
 He published the song "Go to Pyongyang" through the Internet Song site which says: "Go to Pyongyang, if you feel it hard to eke out a living. There you will find people living in smile, though things are difficult."    
 In light of the NSL its composer would be a violator of the law on incitement and encouragement of infiltration into "the anti-state organization" and escape from south Korea, propaganda and praise of the organization, he said, hoping that he would be the last victim to the NSL, the evil law of the era.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by the secretary general.
